isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - STOPMASTER WEDGE TYPE BRAKE - INSTALL

step1.para: Clean all parts thoroughly and inspect. Check angled faces of wedge to see that they are free from pits or marks. Inspect roller retainer cage to make sure it will contain rollers properly and inspect the spring for marks that would cause breakage. Replace parts if necessary.
Insert wedge shaft into roller retainer cage so angled faces of the wedge head are exposed.

Insert a thin-bladed screwdriver between flat of the wedge head and roller retainer cage ( Figure 26). Spread cage open just far enough to insert roller (journal hub into cage slot). Tip roller into cage and position other journal hub into slot of retainer. Install other roller in same manner and remove screwdriver. Do not force rollers through ends of the cage slots.

Install spring retainer over wedge shaft and position centrally over cage and roller assembly. Install rubber boot when used. Current production and service replacement use a spring retainer that has two tabs or protrusions on the O.D. ( Figure 40).

These tabs serve to align the wedge assembly as it is installed into the plunger housing by engaging grooves in the wedge bore ( Figure 41). If the plunger housing is not equipped with such grooves, remove the tabs at the break-off marks and file the O.D. of the retainer smooth.
